intro: Bistorta calostachya, commonly known as narrow-leaved bistorta, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, somewhat woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and arranged in dense, clustered inflorescences. Bistorta calostachya is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
